Comment: Continuation of the Recessed Meeting of May 19, 2022 HELD on May 26, 2022

Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON STATE AND FEDERAL LEGISLATION

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Gounardes, S.1608, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.4006, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to the appointment and promotion of certain personnel of the sanitation department of the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Relates to the appointment and promotion of certain personnel of the sanitation department of the city of New York. (S.1608/A.4006)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Gounardes, Biaggi, Cleare, Gianaris, Hoylman, Jackson, Kavanagh, Krueger, Myrie, Persaud, Ramos, Rivera, and Sepulveda, S.5602-B, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member Glick), A.10438, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo  speed violation  monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; and to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million or more a demonstration program implementing speed  violation  monitoring  systems  in  school speed  zones  by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Relates to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York - Speed Cameras. (S.5602-B/A.10438)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to abating rodents as a requirement for the issuance of certain construction permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Abating rodents as a requirement for the issuance of certain construction permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to provide records of complaints and investigations of bias-based profiling to the city commission on human rights
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the PD to provide records of complaints and investigations of bias-based profiling to the city commission on human rights.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Education to implement a robust requirement for civics education at the elementary, middle and high school level for all public schools in New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to implement a robust requirement for civics education at the elementary, middle and high school level for all public schools in NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to unlawful methods of restraint during an arrest or attempted arrest
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Unlawful methods of restraint during an arrest or attempted arrest.

Items.Title: A Local Law to create a commission to examine the cost of renovating jail facilities on Rikers Island
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Create a commission to examine the cost of renovating jail facilities on Rikers Island.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the undertaking of surveys before planting trees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Undertaking of surveys before planting trees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the preparation of five-year capital plans for parks on a community board level
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the preparation of five-year capital plans for parks on a community board level.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of environmental protection to post information online regarding scheduled and requested infrastructure services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring DEP to post information online regarding scheduled and requested infrastructure services.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing February 16th annually as Lithuania Independence Day in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Recognizing February 16th annually as Lithuania Independence Day in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a pesticide use reporting manual published by the department of parks and recreation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Pesticide use reporting manual published by the dept of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mold assessments in class A multiple dwellings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Mold assessments in class A multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring officers and employees of city contractors to report corruption and to cooperate with the department of investigation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Oversight and Investigations
Items.MatterName: Requiring officers and employees of city contractors to report corruption and to cooperate with the DOI.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a pilot program for the use of unmanned aircraft systems in the inspection of the exterior walls of buildings greater than six stories in height
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Pilot program for the use of unmanned aircraft systems in the inspection of the exterior walls of buildings greater than six stories in height.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to assigning a unique identifying number to each zoning lot in the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Assigning a unique identifying number to each zoning lot in the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing timelines for the approval of permits and expanding real time tracking of pending permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Establishing timelines for the approval of permits and expanding real time tracking of pending permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing city agencies to operate small remotely piloted aircraft
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Authorizing city agencies to operate small remotely piloted aircraft.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the maximum fee allowed when transferring money to a person in the custody of the department of correction
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Maximum fee allowed when transferring money to a person in the custody of the department of correction.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to extending scheduled vehicle retirement dates for taxicabs during the COVID-19 state disaster emergency and the repeal thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Extending scheduled vehicle retirement dates for taxicabs during the COVID-19 state disaster emergency and the repeal thereof.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.492/A.4128A, which would authorize boards of elections in New York State to establish absentee ballot drop-off locations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Authorize boards of elections in New York State to establish absentee ballot drop-off locations. (S.492/A.4128A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the President to establish an anti-Semitism task force.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: President to establish an anti-Semitism task force.

Items.Title: The Acting President Pro Tempore will call the meeting to order.
Items.AgendaNote: The Acting President Pro Tempore will call the meeting to order.

Items.Title: Roll Call
The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum.
Items.AgendaNote: The Clerk will announce the presence of a quorum.
Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

Items.Title: The Acting President Pro Tempore will adjourn the recessed meeting.
Items.AgendaNote: The Acting President Pro Tempore will adjourn the recessed meeting.
Items.MinutesNote:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned the Recessed Meeting of May 19, 2022 held on May 26, 2022  to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, May 26, 2022.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: STATED MEETING OF MAY 26, 2022

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Comrie and Liu, S.3259, and Assembly Member Vanel, A.3817, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and  the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to increasing the fine for tractor-trailer combinations that park on residential streets overnight”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increases the fine for tractor-trailer combinations that park on residential streets overnight. (S.3259/A.3817)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Addabbo, S.9125, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member Abbate), A.10373, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in relation to the pensionable earnings of first grade police officers”.
Items.ActionText:
A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council defeated by Roll Call.

Did not received 2/3 affirmative threshold for SLR Home Rule Item.
Items.MatterName: Provides for the pension benefits for first grade police officers of the city of New York who have served for 25 or 30 years. (S.9125/A.10373)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Bailey, S.9327, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member Abbate), A.10360, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in  relation  to allowing  certain  members of the New York city police pension fund to borrow from contributions”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Relates to allowing certain members of the New York city police pension fund to borrow from contributions. (S.9327/A.10360)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Jackson, S.9068-B, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member De Los Santos), A.10285-B, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland  of  a  portion of real property in the county of New York and to grant easements to the metropolitan transportation authority  so  that it  may  make  handicapped accessible improvements and upgrades to the New York city transit authority 168 Street transit station”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: 168th Street Station Alienation. Authorizes the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of real property in the county of New York and to grant certain rights to the metropolitan transportation authority. (S.9068-B/A.10285-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Sepulveda, S.9120-A, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member Benedetto), A.10443, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to  discontinue  a  portion  of real  property  in  the  county  of the Bronx as parkland and to grant easements for improvements  to  the  railroad  right-of-way  to  bring Metro-North  railroad service to four new stations in the Bronx and to Pennsylvania Station in the county of New York”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Penn Station Access - Authorizes the discontinuance of parkland and the granting of easements for improvements to the Metro-North railroad. (S.9120-A/A.10443-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Salazar, S.9323-A, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member Walker), A.10449, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland a portion of real property in the  borough  of  Brooklyn  and  to transfer  such  lands to the metropolitan transportation authority, to enable the New York city transit authority to construct in such  areas new permanent at-grade station improvements and pedestrian bridges”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Broadway-Junction Station - Authorizes discontinuing the use as parkland of certain real property in Brooklyn for improvements and upgrades to the Broadway Junction transit station. (S.9323-A/A.10449)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Comrie and Liu, S.3259, and Assembly Member Vanel, A.3817, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and  the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to increasing the fine for tractor-trailer combinations that park on residential streets overnight”.
Items.MatterName: Increases the fine for tractor-trailer combinations that park on residential streets overnight. (S.3259/A.3817)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, June 2, 2022.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote:
The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Preconsidered SLR No. 6,  VOTE:  43-7-0
Negative: CMs Ariola Carr, Mealy, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli).

Preconsidered SLR No. 8,  VOTE: 30-4-16
Negative;  CMs Avilés, Barron, Mealy, Richardson Jordan;
Abstentions:CMs Cabán, Farías, De La Rosa, Gutiérrez, Hanif, Hudson, Joseph, Krishnan, Louis, Marte, Nurse, Ossé, Restler, Sanchez, Stevens and Won.

Preconsidered SLR No. 9,  VOTE: 43-3-4
Negative: CMs Avilés, Barron and Mealy;
Abstentions: CMs Hanif, Joseph, Richardson Jordan and Won.

Preconsidered SLR No. 11,  VOTE; 49-1-0
Negative: CM Barron.
The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
